reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on our Honeymoon and had an amazing time. We stayed three nights here before moving on. The views were amazing. It was great to be able to go to Positano and Amalfi on the bus with no issues. Getting there was nuts for us but we found it no problem. We loved this place. The views were like no other I have ever seen. If you have problems with stairs than this place is not for you but other than that amazing. We wished we could have stayed longer. We did a day trip to Capri which was great and the views are amazing but unless you can afford Gucci, Armani & Rolex it is just about the views and the boat ride (which are amazing). Stay here and you will be blown away! Trip of a lifetime for us and this was the best of three Hotels (the others were in Rome & Sorrento and less about the view and place).
reviews.title: Perfect Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel le Sirene is a lovely B & B, situated right on the cliffs in the small village of Praiano, between Positano and Amalfi, looking out over the ocean and across the bay to Positano. This B & B is spotlessly clean and very well maintained.
reviews.title: Spectacular Views on the Amalfi Coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maria is a lovely host. We didn't see alot of her husband. They obviously take great pride in their home and work hard to keep it looking lovely. We were just in awe the first time we went out on the balcony and saw the views. The breakfasts were delicious. Also you can order "snacks' which Maria will happily make for you. Delicious bruschetta, platters of meats and cheeses, all made with fresh ingredients.
reviews.title: Highlight of our Italian trip, a hidden gem on the Amalfi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B & B is perfect, but the two downsides are, the stairs from the road up above. We were very surprised when we arrived by how far down we had to walk carrying our luggage. There are well over 100 stairs, plus about 3 ramps down, which means every time you are going out anywhere you have to walk back up all of those stairs. We managed fine, but I think people need to be prepared. The other thing is that Praiano is a very small town. So don't expect alot of choices for restaurants or shops. There are restaurants, but we found them, by Italian standards, not to be that good and quite expensive.
reviews.title: beautiful views

likes.liked: — The Beautiful Sea Views from the room balcony
likes.disliked: — Located in a Very quiet town

reviews.text: So overall, the B & B is lovely, the location can be challenging, but worth the hike up and down the stairs, and the town disappointing. You can take a bus to Positano, but I'm not sure how late it runs at night and those roads are somewhat scarey to be going back and forth on.
reviews.title: Great value, Fantastic location, Very helpful hosts
Why pay more???
reviews.text: Not only does this little gem have a great location, it is clean, and the views are to die for...You ae in the middle of all the towns easy access by bus to all, and to Capri...The vegetaion is lovely with lemon trees and flowers and balconies over looking the ocean and you can see Capri in the distance...The morning breakfast is soooo peaceful and you sit there on the ocean just saying "pinch me"....Giancarmine is a great hotel owner and makes the best Cappuchinno...I think I will have two of them....he is helpful and Gracious ...we traveled with others and we had three rooms I checked them all...each one was fantastic with balcony and views.....Don't miss this wonderful spot, you will be glad you went ....we had a drink at Le saranuse which is 5 times more and the view was the same....can't wait to go back in May....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found le Sirene through word of mouth of a friend, and never having been to the Amafli Coast region, we weren't sure at all what to expect. What we found was a blissfully quiet, immaculately clean, comfortable place, conveniently located in Praiano (one town down from Positano). The hotel is perched on a bluff overhanging the sea, and the views are simply stunning (look at my pictures and my video). The rooms each have a private veranda looking out on the seascape. Standing on the veranda and looking out at that perfect view, we felt like millionaires. We couldn't believe such a nice place was available for such a decent price. The owners are fun and very sweet and generous. When I go back to the Amafli Coast, this is where I will stay, for sure.
reviews.title: An unbeleivable find - the perfect Amalfi Coast hotel

likes.liked: — The location was phenominal. Also, the hotel itself was gorgeous.
likes.disliked: — There are a lot of steps in the Amalfi region. Be prepared to do some climbing!

reviews.text: Great little inn on the moutain of Praiano. Rooms overlook sea with balcony, great breakfast included each morning, hosts are very friendly and the beach below is amazing.
reviews.title: Great Small Hotel

reviews.text: From the second we stepped off the bus in Praiano, we loved our stay at Le Sirene. The first thing you'll notice is the quiet - the birds chirping and the sound of the sea below. If you're craving to get away from the hustle and bustle, this is the place to go. Our hosts, Giancarlo and Maria, were charming and gracious. They would do anything to accommodate us and help us during our stay. And, our room, while simple, was a slice of heaven with a terrace overlooking tiered gardens leading down to the sea. The beautiful view showed the colorful town of Positano just over the sea, and Capri in the far distance - just breathtaking. Breakfast was a nice assortment of mixed fruit salad (different every morning), juice, cheeses and meats, and a variety of breads.
reviews.title: Serene at Le Sirene

likes.liked: — The hosts and the beautiful location / view.

reviews.text: In Praiano, we found good restaurants (Le Brace and Le Strada), both serving great meals with terrific views of the Amalfi coast and the sea, to boot. If you order the fish, they'll filet it right in front of you (cooked.) There's also a little wine bar next door to Le Strada that we enjoyed. A good mix of tourists and locals.
reviews.title: Simple and Beautiful. A Gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other great thing about the Praiano location is that it is so easy to get to other towns for day trips. The bus is a short walk from the hotel and an easy way to get to Positano, Ravello or Amalfi. (I recommend skipping the last.) And, after a great day of being tourists in busy tourist areas, we were always so happy to get back to our little Praiano. We recommend this area and hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Serene paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a traveler, I´m sometimes torn between telling the world about a great place, or keeping it to myself, afraid it will be ruined if revealed. Well, after some thinking, here´s a gem:
reviews.title: Too good to be true.

reviews.text: Hotel Le Sirene has simple, clean rooms with terraces and beautiful views of the Amalfi coast and bay. The staff is super-friendly and laidback and the experience just could not be better. Theres a 5 minute walk down the stonepath to the shore where you can relax/eat/swin or, (after climbilng the stairs again- its Amalfi after all) a one minute walk up from the hotel to the church square and three restaurants.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location

likes.liked: — The service, the view and the tranquility

reviews.text: We chose to stay in Praiano to avoid the crowds in the larger towns. The day we arrived the band was playing "La Boheme" in the San Gennaro church square and we knew we were in paradise. After navigating the stairs down, we reached the most perfect place imaginable; breakfast on the terrace is an unforgettable experience and watching the lights of Positano from our balcony kept us up at night. Giancarmine and Maria were delightful hosts. An extraordinary place; the beauty of which will stay with us forever.
reviews.title: A miraculous experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent five days here on our honeymoon. Booked it off of recommendations from Tripadvisor. Sprung for room with a terrace (larger than the balcony) and had an incredible view, both from our terrace, which had big french doors that we left open each day to take in the view, and off the side window, which showed the cliff side. Great location, lots of steps, but nothing like some of the other hotels. Easy to get to, as it's right in the middle of praiano, right by the bus stop.
reviews.title: Beautiful view and perfect escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Owners were wonderful, very helpful and had delicious breakfast and coffee. Chased us down when we thought we had slept in too long past (too much wine one night) breakfast and made sure we had food and coffee. Very sweet.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are bare, but very clean, and we weren't totally used to the european bathrooms, but, they worked and the view was just too amazing to complain about anything.
reviews.title: heaven in a bottle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only complaint we did have was it seemed our room had a smell, only during the mid day, perhaps the septic system? But it came and went, and we opened our doors and it didnt' both us.
reviews.title: A serene and beautiful escape
